The easiest way to get started with ValidMind is to try out our developer framework and explore the ValidMind UI. 

## Try out the ValidMind developer framework

```{mermaid}
%%| fig-width: 7
flowchart LR
  A(Notebook <i class='fa-brands fa-python'></i>)
  B(Notebook <i class='fa-brands fa-r-project'></i>)
  A --> C(Initialize<br>framework)
  B --> C
  C --> D(Prepare<br>dataset)
  D --> E(Run test<br>plans)
  E --> F(Train<br>model)
  F --> G(Upload to<br>ValidMind)
```

For model developers, we recommend that you check out the running sample Jupyter notebooks and then try modifying our the notebooks yourself. These notebooks show you how to initialize the developer framework, prepare a demo dataset, run test plans, train a model, and then upload to the ValidMind platform. 

Check out the running notebooks:

- [ValidMind Python Library Introduction](../notebooks/intro.ipynb) — {{< fa brands python >}}
